title.narrative: Danish Energy Agency Energy Partnership Programme (DEPP) 2020-2025

description.narrative: Danish Energy Agency Energy Partnership Programme (DEPP) 2020-2025

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Capacity of the National Institute of Ecology and Climate (INECC) developed to independently prepare climate change mitigation modelling, integrating energy and transport, including economic, social and environmental co-benefits, to understand impact of different policy actions for Mexico.

- Modelling tools applied with focus on sector integration that consider co-benefits. - Scenarios developed to demonstrate low carbon pathways for various sectors, supporting more ambitious climate change mitigation targets and co-benefits impact. - Communication of modelling results to sectors, based on creditable data, that allow authorities in other sectors to apply the results in development of sector policies and plans.

target.value: Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected final output target.

actual.value: Activity partly on track because of delays in completion of agreed 2021 activities.

target.value: Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected final output target.

Modelling tools in place and in a process of being calibrated - Scenarios reflecting short, medium- and long-term goals developed jointly by INECC and SEMARNAT, and consulted among stakeholders -Inform the update of the national strategy on climate change
Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected final output target.

Advanced use of modelling tools is part of INECCs standard procedures - Additional scenarios include and assess co-benefits, reflecting short, medium- and long-term goals developed jointly by INECC and SEMARNAT and consulted among stakeholders

title.narrative: Minisytry of Trade and Industry capacitated to independently prepare high-quality integrated scenario-based long-term modelling of the Vietnamese energy system presented in biennial EORs, to provide significant support to Vietnamese national energy system planning and policy development processes
EOR preparation, independently led by EREA and based on high quality data, develops NDC scenarios that are incorporated into the power planning and policy development

target.value: Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected mid-term and final output target.

actual.value:
Activity on track according to WP 2021.
However, the launch of the Energy Outlook Report was expected by 2021, however, the launch has been to summer 2022 instead.

target.value: Vietnam Energy Outlook Report is prepared in cooperation between Electricity and Renewable Energy Authority and Danish Energy Agency with significant external support and is used as input to national energy plans.
Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected mid-term and final output target.

Vietnam EOR is developed and published, headed by Electricity and Renewable Energy Authority with support from Danish Energy Agency, and used for national energy plans, including the Power Development Plan.
Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected mid-term and final output target.

Electricity and Renewable Energy Authority leads, independently, the development of further improved Vietnam Energy Outlook Report and uses it to support national energy plans, including the revision of Power Development Plan with pathways to meet the Nationally Determined Contribution targets.

title.narrative: Energy system modelling of the entire energy sector developed, including socioeconomic and sector specific analyses that support the definition of low carbon energy strategies.
ERI produces high-quality bottom-up modelling of the complete energy sector, which forms the basis for policy making and target definition related to the low carbon development of the energy sector.

target.value: Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected mid-term and final output target.
Energy Research Institute’s modelling capability expanded to consider the complete energy sector and carry out socio-economic analyses.
Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected mid-term and final output target.
Energy Research Institute’s modelling and analysis of the complete energy sector provides input to the draft of the 15th Five Year Plan.
Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected mid-term and final output target.

actual.value: Satisfactory annual progress with the draft development of the 2021 China Energy Transition Outlook report which was presented at the COP26.

title.narrative: Capacity building from Danish Energy Agency has resulted in progress of grid codes for increasing renewable energy penetration, changing load patterns for promoting efficient operation of the network.
- Recommended amendments and enhancements proposed on technical regulations (grid codes) -Reco mmended actions taken regarding demand resource connection requirements

target.value: Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected mid-term and final output target.

. Gap analysis on SO and SDR codes provided guidance on how the gaps need to be addressed and solved 2. Gap analysis on demand resource connection requirements provided guidance on how the gaps need to be addressed and solved.
Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected mid-term and final output target.
Progress in implementing annual activities towards the expected mid-term and final output target.

actual.value: Several workshops have been held with the purpose of planning the revision of the relevant system operator and system dispatch grid codes in South Africa to accommodate an increased penetration of renewable energy sources. The focus and interest has increased greatly since the regulator, NERSA, changed the licensing requirements now allowing for smaller renewable energy plants to be constructed quicker.
